header.title: Responsible Health AI Lab at University of Washington Tacoma

left.text: RHAIL supported by AIM-AHEAD Program for AI Readiness (PAIR)
left.textSubsidiary: The RHAIL lab at the University of Washington Tacoma is a collaborative effort between the School of Engineering and Technology and the School of Nursing and Healthcare Leadership. This interdisciplinary partnership is at the core of our mission. We believe that innovative applications of AI hold immense potential in addressing a wide range of challenges related to disease prevention, diagnosis and treatment, and self- and family management of chronic health conditions. Our primary goal is to pioneer responsible AI solutions that offer the same high-quality service to all patients and families.

three.text-3-3: Focusing on the use of Large Language Models to expand access to care and on synthetic data generation to foster AI with sensitive patient data

regionThree.titleSecondary: Our lab is sponsored by a PAIR award administered by AIM-AHEAD (NIH). Learn more about PAIR and how you can get involved!

regionFour.titleSecondary: Get in Touch, Let's Make an Impact Together

body.content: I am interested in contacting you to learn more about RHAIL.

FacultyList.name: Martine De Cock, Ph.D.
FacultyList.title: Professor
FacultyList.introduction: Dr. Martine De Cock is a Professor at the School of Engineering and Technology, University of Washington Tacoma, and a guest professor at Ghent University. She holds M.Sc. and Ph.D. degrees in Computer Science from Ghent University. Dr. De Cock has extensive experience in artificial intelligence, data mining, machine learning, and information retrieval, with over 150 peer-reviewed publications. She has served as a visiting scholar at the University of California, Berkeley, and Stanford University. Her current research focuses on privacy-preserving AI and data analytics to improve healthcare.

FacultyList.name: Weichao Yuwen, Ph.D.
FacultyList.title: Associate Professor
FacultyList.introduction: Dr. Weichao Yuwen is an Associate Professor at the University of Washington Tacoma. She conducts research in developing, testing, and disseminating technology-enabled health solutions for individuals with chronic conditions and their family caregivers. Dr. Yuwen is actively involved in the American Medical Informatics Association and the International Family Nursing Association and is a founding board member of the Pacific-Northwest Chinese Nurses Association. Her interdisciplinary research contributes to innovative digital health interventions that enhance patient care and support networks.

FacultyList.name: Ling-Hong Hung, Ph.D.
FacultyList.title: Research Assistant Professor
FacultyList.introduction: Dr. Ling-Hong Hung is a Research Assistant Professor at the University of Washington Tacoma with expertise in bioinformatics, big data, and machine learning. His research integrates computational methodologies to process and analyze large-scale biological data, contributing to advancements in genomics and biomedical informatics. Dr. Hung's work is instrumental in the development of efficient algorithms for data-driven insights in medical and biological sciences.

EventList.col1: Two RHAIL students receive 2025 Population Health Recognition Award at the University of Washington
EventList.col3: Mahek Nizar and Mahriban Yalkapova are awarded for their work on the project “AI-Augmented Chatbot for Tuberculosis Treatment Support”. This project is a collaboration between RHAIL and Dr. Sarah Iribarren at the UW Seattle School of Nursing

EventList.col1: Two RHAIL students honored among the 2025 Husky 100 at the University of Washington
EventList.col3: Daniil Filienko and Geetha Sitaraman are included in the Husky 100 of 2025. The Husky 100 recognizes 100 students who are making the most out of their time at the UW.

EventList.col1: RHAIL student receives Mary Gates Scholarship for Undergraduate Research
EventList.col3: Shane Menzies has been awarded a Mary Gates Scholarship to work on synthetic data generation for rare diseases.

EventList.col1: Presentation on Tuberculosis Project at AAAI 2025 Workshop
EventList.col3: We presented our work on 'Transforming Tuberculosis Care: Optimizing Large Language Models for Enhanced Clinician-Patient Communication' at the AAAI 2025 workshop on Generative AI for Health.

EventList.col1: Presentation on Privacy-Preserving Synthetic Data Generation at AAAI 2025 Workshop
EventList.col3: We presented our work on 'End-to-End Collaborative Synthetic Data Generation' at the 6th Privacy-Preserving AI workshop at AAAI 2025, with a use case for privacy-preserving publishing of synthetic genomic data for leukemia.

EventList.col1: RHAIL is awarded an NSF NAIRR Demonstration Project Grant
EventList.col3: The project, in collaboration with Sage Bionetworks, revolves around synthetic data generation for rare diseases.

EventList.col1: RHAIL student receives NIH AIM-AHEAD Research Fellowship
EventList.col3: Daniil Filienko has been awarded a NIH AIM-AHEAD Research Fellowship, Cohort 3.

EventList.col1: RHAIL receives NIH AIM-AHEAD PAIR Phase 2 Award
EventList.col3: RHAIL is a NIH AIM-AHEAD PAIR Phase 2 awardee.

EventList.col1: RHAIL receives pilot funding from UW Institute of Translational Health Sciences
EventList.col3: Our project on using generative AI to assist cultural and linguistic adaptations of clinical trial materials has been awarded pilot funding by the UW Institute of Translational Health Sciences.

EventList.col1: Paper on GPT-delivered Problem-Solving Therapy at AMIA 2024 Annual Symposium
EventList.col3: Our paper on comparing prompting techniques to improve GPT-delivered Problem-Solving Therapy is accepted for presentation at the AMIA 2024 Annual Symposium.

EventList.col1: Poster on Tuberculosis project accepted Poster at MIE 2024
EventList.col3: Our poster on developing an AI-assisted platform to support tuberculosis care delivery is accepted for presentation at the 34th Medical Informatics Europe (MIE2024) conference.
RHAIL alumna Caroline El Jazmi was recognized in the Commencement speech of UW Tacoma Chancellor Lange.

EventList.col1: RHAIL receives UW Population Health Initiative Pilot Grant
EventList.col3: RHAIL received a UW Population Health Initiative pilot research grant on 'Building and evaluating AI-augmented treatment support for individuals with tuberculosis' in collaboration with Biobehavioral Nursing and Health Informatics (UW Seattle).

EventList.col1: RHAIL receives UW Tacoma Founders Endowment Grant
EventList.col3: RHAIL received a UW Tacoma Founders Endowment Grant for research on 'Privacy-Preserving Generative AI for Equitable Cancer Research'.

EventList.col1: RHAIL students receive Andrew and Julie Fry Innovation Award
EventList.col3: Daniil Filienko and Caroline El Jazmi received the Andrew and Julie Fry Innovation Award at the School of Engineering and Technology for their work on the 'Caring for Caregivers Online' (COCO) project.

EventList.col1: RHAIL student selected for AIM-AHEAD Traineeship
EventList.col3: Steven Golob has been selected for an AIM-AHEAD Traineeship in Advanced Data Analysis using the All of Us Clinical Database.

EventList.col1: RHAIL receives NIH AIM-AHEAD PAIR Phase 1 Award
EventList.col3: The RHAIL lab has been selected for the first NIH supported AIM-AHEAD PAIR cohort.
We received a UW Global Innovation Fund award in support of our research on 'Fair and Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning for Chronic Disease Symptom Management'.
